column4: I'm having an interesting error with ubuntu... I can ping my router and anything in my home network, but not WAN ip's...
I'm using 12.04
Well I can ping from other computers
I mean I can ping external ip's from my other desktop computer
How do I disable the firewall?
I disabled ufw but that didn't help
my router's ip
Well that works
THen your good to go.
host av.com
What nameserver are you using? cat /etc/resolv.conf
You need a nameserver other than 127.0.0.1  Edit the file and place a valid nameserver in it.
nameserver 8.8.8.8
route -n
Do you see the router's IP there?
Good, then edit the /etc/resolv.conf file and add a valid nameserver.  Then check your router and see why it's not giving out a nameserver IP.
Can you ping your router's IP?
host av.com    #Does it give you any IPs?
Good idea.
route -n  #Does it show your router's IP as default gateway?
Maybe you need to reboot the router.
Does your router not have a dhcp server running on it?
Just do   host av.com
